intro: Portenschlagia integrifolia, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy white or pink flowers. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape and have a smooth, entire margin. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
